intro: Mentha stenotricha, commonly known as narrow-haired mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves covered in fine, stiff hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stems. Mentha stenotricha is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
